channel.title: Azure AI Foundry Model Updates
channel.description: Latest updates on Azure AI Foundry models sold directly by Azure

item.title: gpt-5.3-codex
item.description: A GPT-5.3 series reasoning model optimized for Codex CLI and the Codex VS Code extension. It supports structured outputs, multimodal (text/image) processing, and tool/function calling via the Responses API. Availability requires registration and is limited to specific Global Standard regions.

item.title: gpt-5.2-codex
item.description: A GPT-5.2 series reasoning model focused on coding workflows and optimized for Codex tooling. It supports structured outputs, text/image processing, and parallel tool calling via the Responses API. Registration is required and it is explicitly listed in East US2 and Sweden Central (Global Standard).

item.title: gpt-5.2
item.description: A GPT-5.2 series reasoning model available through both the Chat Completions API and the Responses API. It supports structured outputs, multimodal text/image processing, and functions/tools with parallel tool calling. Registration is required; region availability is referenced via the models table.

item.title: gpt-5.2-chat
item.description: A GPT-5.2 chat model offered as a preview, usable with both Chat Completions and Responses APIs. It supports structured outputs and tool/function calling (including parallel tool calling). Microsoft cautions against production use of preview models and notes preview lifecycle differences.

item.title: gpt-5.1
item.description: A GPT-5.1 series reasoning model supporting both Chat Completions and Responses APIs with structured outputs and multimodal text/image processing. It includes functions/tools and parallel tool calling. Registration is required; region availability is referenced via the models table.

item.title: gpt-5.1-chat
item.description: A GPT-5.1 chat model in preview that adds built-in reasoning capabilities. It supports Chat Completions and Responses APIs, structured outputs, and tool/function calling with parallel tool calling. Microsoft warns preview models are not recommended for production and may be auto-upgraded.

item.title: gpt-5.1-codex
item.description: A GPT-5.1 Codex-optimized model available via the Responses API only. It supports structured outputs, text/image processing, and functions/tools with parallel tool calling, and is optimized for Codex CLI and the Codex VS Code extension. Registration is required; region availability is referenced via the models table.

item.title: gpt-5.1-codex-mini
item.description: A smaller GPT-5.1 Codex-optimized model available via the Responses API only. It supports structured outputs, text/image processing, and functions/tools with parallel tool calling, and is optimized for Codex CLI and the Codex VS Code extension. Region availability is referenced via the models table.

item.title: gpt-5.1-codex-max
item.description: A GPT-5.1 Codex model variant available via the Responses API only and optimized for Codex tooling. It adds support for setting reasoning_effort to xhigh, and does not support reasoning_effort=none. Registration is required; region availability is referenced via the models table.

item.title: gpt-5
item.description: A GPT-5 series reasoning model supporting both Chat Completions and Responses APIs. It includes structured outputs, multimodal text/image processing, and functions/tools with parallel tool calling. Registration is required for gpt-5; region availability is referenced via the models table.

item.title: gpt-5-mini
item.description: A smaller GPT-5 series reasoning model supporting Chat Completions and Responses APIs. It provides structured outputs, multimodal text/image processing, and functions/tools with parallel tool calling. It does not require registration; region availability is referenced via the models table.

item.title: gpt-5-nano
item.description: A compact GPT-5 series reasoning model supporting Chat Completions and Responses APIs. It supports structured outputs, multimodal text/image processing, and functions/tools with parallel tool calling. It does not require registration; region availability is referenced via the models table.

item.title: gpt-5-chat
item.description: A GPT-5 chat model offered in preview that accepts text/image input and produces text output. It is available via both Chat Completions and Responses APIs. Version 2025-10-03 adds an emotional intelligence and mental health-focused enhancement; preview models are not recommended for production.

item.title: gpt-5-codex
item.description: A GPT-5 Codex-optimized model available via the Responses API only. It supports structured outputs, text/image processing, and functions/tools with parallel tool calling, and is optimized for Codex CLI and the Codex VS Code extension. Registration is required; region availability is referenced via the models table.

item.title: gpt-5-pro
item.description: A GPT-5 series reasoning model available via the Responses API with structured outputs and multimodal text/image processing. It supports functions and tools and targets high-capability reasoning use cases. Registration is required; region availability is referenced via the models table.

item.title: gpt-oss-120b
item.description: An open-weight reasoning model (preview) for text-in/text-out workloads using the Chat Completions API. It supports streaming, function calling, and structured outputs, and is available for deployment and via managed compute. Unlike other Azure OpenAI models, deploying gpt-oss-120b requires a Foundry project.

item.title: gpt-oss-20b
item.description: An open-weight reasoning model (preview) for text-in/text-out workloads using the Chat Completions API. It supports streaming, function calling, and structured outputs, and is available via managed compute and Foundry Local. It targets reasoning tasks with a large context window.

item.title: gpt-4.1
item.description: A GPT-4.1 series multimodal model supporting text and image input with text output. It works with both Chat Completions and Responses APIs and supports streaming, function calling, and structured outputs (Chat Completions). A known issue can cause failures when tool/function definitions exceed 300,000 tokens despite the larger context limit.

item.title: gpt-4.1-mini
item.description: A GPT-4.1 series multimodal model supporting text and image input with text output. It supports Chat Completions and Responses APIs, streaming, function calling, and structured outputs (Chat Completions). It shares the same known issue where very large tool/function definitions can trigger failures around 300,000 tokens.

item.title: gpt-4.1-nano
item.description: A GPT-4.1 series multimodal model supporting text and image input with text output. It supports Chat Completions and Responses APIs, streaming, function calling, and structured outputs (Chat Completions). It is affected by the same known issue involving oversized tool/function definitions exceeding ~300,000 tokens.

item.title: computer-use-preview
item.description: An experimental model trained for use with the Responses API computer use tool. It can control mouse/keyboard via third-party libraries while using screenshots as visual context. It is a preview model requiring registration and is not recommended for production use.

item.title: codex-mini
item.description: An o-series model that is a fine-tuned version of o4-mini, optimized for coding-oriented reasoning. It supports the Responses API, structured outputs, text/image processing, and functions/tools. Region availability is explicitly listed for East US2 and Sweden Central (Global Standard).

item.title: o3-pro
item.description: An advanced o-series reasoning model designed for focused problem solving in areas like science, coding, and math. It supports the Responses API, structured outputs, text/image processing, and functions/tools. Region availability is explicitly listed for East US2 and Sweden Central (Global Standard).

item.title: o4-mini
item.description: A newer o-series reasoning model offering enhanced reasoning abilities. It supports both Chat Completions and Responses APIs, structured outputs, multimodal text/image processing, and functions/tools. Region availability is referenced via the models table.

item.title: o3
item.description: A newer o-series reasoning model with enhanced reasoning abilities and support for parallel tool calling. It supports Chat Completions and Responses APIs, structured outputs, and text/image processing. Region availability is referenced via the models table.

item.title: o3-mini
item.description: A smaller o-series reasoning model focused on enhanced reasoning with text-only processing. It supports structured outputs and functions/tools. Region availability is referenced via the models table.

item.title: o1
item.description: An o-series reasoning model with enhanced reasoning abilities and support for structured outputs. It supports text and image processing plus functions/tools. Region availability is referenced via the models table.

item.title: o1-preview
item.description: An older preview version in the o1 series. It is available only to customers who were granted access as part of the original limited access program. Region availability is referenced via the models table with explicit limited-access constraints.

item.title: o1-mini
item.description: A faster and more cost-efficient o1-series option, positioned as ideal for coding tasks requiring speed and lower resource consumption. Global Standard deployment is available by default, while Standard (regional) deployments are limited to select customers from the o1-preview limited access release. Access to regional deployments is not being expanded.

item.title: gpt-4o
item.description: A multimodal GPT-4o (Omni) model that integrates text and images in a single model for improved responsiveness and accuracy. It supports structured outputs, JSON mode, and parallel function calling, with strong vision and non-English performance. Multiple dated versions are listed, and availability varies by region and deployment type.

item.title: gpt-4o-mini
item.description: A fast, inexpensive multimodal model intended as a capable replacement for GPT-3.5 Turbo series models. It supports text and image processing plus JSON mode and parallel function calling. Availability varies by region and deployment type.

item.title: gpt-4 (turbo-2024-04-09)
item.description: GPT-4 Turbo with Vision is a generally available model and a replacement for earlier GPT-4 preview models (vision-preview, 1106-Preview, 0125-Preview). It can be used only with the Chat Completions API, and feature availability varies by input method and deployment type. Provisioned deployments of this model are noted as currently limited to text only.

item.title: text-embedding-3-large
item.description: The latest and most capable third-generation embeddings model for converting text into vectors for similarity and retrieval. It supports a dimensions parameter to reduce embedding size for cost/performance control, and shows improved multilingual retrieval performance (MIRACL) and strong English performance (MTEB). It cannot be upgraded to from older embeddings without regenerating embeddings.

item.title: text-embedding-3-small
item.description: A third-generation embeddings model that converts text into vectors for similarity and retrieval. It offers improved multilingual retrieval performance versus older embeddings while maintaining strong English benchmark performance. It supports reducing embedding dimensionality via the dimensions parameter (subject to client library support).

item.title: text-embedding-ada-002
item.description: A legacy embeddings model used to convert text into numerical vectors for similarity search and retrieval. The page notes you cannot upgrade between embeddings models; migrating to newer embedding models requires generating new embeddings. Two versions are listed with different max request token limits.

item.title: dall-e-3
item.description: An image generation model that creates original images from natural language prompts. It is generally available for use with REST APIs, while DALL-E 3 with client SDKs is in preview. Region availability is explicitly listed (East US, Australia East, Sweden Central).

item.title: gpt-image-1
item.description: A GPT-image-1 series image generation model in limited access preview for generating images from text prompts. Access requires registration and approval based on eligibility criteria, followed by creating a deployment. Region availability is listed across several Global Standard regions (including West US 3, East US 2, UAE North, Poland Central, and Sweden Central).

item.title: gpt-image-1-mini
item.description: A GPT-image-1 series image generation model in limited access preview. It generates images from text prompts and requires registration and approval before deployment. Region availability is listed across multiple Global Standard regions (including West US 3, East US 2, UAE North, Poland Central, and Sweden Central).

item.title: gpt-image-1.5
item.description: A GPT-image-1 series image generation model in limited access preview. It generates images from text prompts and requires registration and approval before deployment. Region availability is listed across multiple Global Standard regions (including West US 3, East US 2, UAE North, Poland Central, and Sweden Central).

item.title: sora
item.description: An OpenAI video generation model that can create realistic and imaginative video scenes from text instructions. It is explicitly described as being in preview. Region availability is listed for East US 2 and Sweden Central (Global Standard).

item.title: sora-2
item.description: A newer Sora video generation model variant listed as NEW. It generates video scenes from text instructions and is part of the preview video generation offering. Region availability is listed for East US 2 and Sweden Central (Global Standard).

item.title: gpt-4o-mini-audio-preview
item.description: A GPT-4o family audio preview model for audio and text generation. It supports large token limits and is intended for audio-capable generation scenarios. As a preview model, it is not recommended for production use.

item.title: gpt-4o-audio-preview
item.description: A GPT-4o family audio preview model for audio and text generation. It supports large token limits and is intended for generating or responding with audio content. As a preview model, it is not recommended for production use.

item.title: gpt-4o-realtime-preview
item.description: A GPT-4o family realtime audio preview model for low-latency, real-time audio processing. Multiple dated versions are listed, indicating iterative updates. As a preview model, it is not recommended for production use.

item.title: gpt-4o-mini-realtime-preview
item.description: A GPT-4o mini family realtime audio preview model for real-time audio processing. It targets low-latency conversational interactions with speech in/out scenarios. As a preview model, it is not recommended for production use.

item.title: gpt-realtime
item.description: A generally available (GA) audio model for real-time audio processing. It is listed alongside related realtime and audio variants, indicating a family of audio-capable models. Availability across regions is referenced via the models table.

item.title: gpt-realtime-mini
item.description: A smaller realtime audio model variant for real-time audio processing. Multiple versions are listed, indicating ongoing updates. Availability across regions is referenced via the models table.

item.title: gpt-realtime-mini-2025-12-15
item.description: A dated version of the gpt-realtime-mini model for real-time audio processing. It is part of the realtime audio model family and indicates a specific release version. Availability across regions is referenced via the models table.

item.title: gpt-realtime-1.5-2026-02-23
item.description: A dated 1.5 version of the gpt-realtime model for real-time audio processing. It indicates a newer release in the realtime audio family with a specific version stamp. Availability across regions is referenced via the models table.

item.title: gpt-audio
item.description: An audio model listed for real-time audio processing within the audio model family. It is presented alongside realtime variants, suggesting support for audio-centric interactions and processing. Availability across regions is referenced via the models table.

item.title: gpt-audio-mini
item.description: A smaller audio model variant listed for real-time audio processing. Multiple versions are listed, indicating iterative updates. Availability across regions is referenced via the models table.

item.title: gpt-audio-1.5-2026-02-23
item.description: A dated 1.5 version of the gpt-audio model listed for real-time audio processing. It indicates a newer release in the audio model family with a specific version stamp. Availability across regions is referenced via the models table.

item.title: whisper
item.description: A general-purpose speech recognition model used for speech-to-text and speech translation via the /audio API. It supports audio file uploads up to 25 MB per request. Availability is presented as part of the Audio API model list.

item.title: gpt-4o-transcribe
item.description: A speech-to-text model powered by GPT-4o, available via the /audio API. It supports audio file uploads up to 25 MB per request. Availability is presented as part of the Audio API model list.

item.title: gpt-4o-mini-transcribe
item.description: A speech-to-text model powered by GPT-4o mini, available via the /audio API. It supports audio file uploads up to 25 MB per request. Availability is presented as part of the Audio API model list.

item.title: gpt-4o-transcribe-diarize
item.description: A speech-to-text model that includes automatic speech recognition features, available via the /audio API. It supports audio file uploads up to 25 MB per request. Availability is presented as part of the Audio API model list.

item.title: gpt-4o-mini-transcribe-2025-12-15
item.description: A dated version of a GPT-4o mini speech-to-text model with automatic speech recognition improvements. It specifically notes improved transcription accuracy and robustness and supports audio file uploads up to 25 MB. Availability is presented as part of the Audio API model list.

item.title: tts
item.description: A preview text-to-speech model optimized for speed, available via the /audio API. It is intended for generating spoken audio from text. Availability is presented as part of the Text-to-speech models (preview) list.

item.title: tts-hd
item.description: A preview text-to-speech model optimized for quality, available via the /audio API. It is intended for higher-fidelity speech generation from text. Availability is presented as part of the Text-to-speech models (preview) list.

item.title: gpt-4o-mini-tts
item.description: A preview text-to-speech model powered by GPT-4o mini. It supports guiding the voice to speak in a specific style or tone. Availability is presented as part of the Text-to-speech models (preview) list and varies by version/region in the models table.

item.title: gpt-4o-mini-tts-2025-12-15
item.description: A dated version of the GPT-4o mini text-to-speech preview model. It supports guiding the voice to speak in a specific style or tone. Availability is presented as part of the Text-to-speech models (preview) list.

item.title: model-router
item.description: A Microsoft model that routes requests to underlying models based on the prompt, supporting text and image input with text output. It provides a large context window (200,000 tokens) and varying max output tokens depending on the routed model. It is available in Global Standard and Data Zone Standard in East US 2 and Sweden Central, with multiple versions listed (including 2025-11-18, 2025-08-07, and 2025-05-19).

item.title: o3-deep-research
item.description: A specialized o-series model variant noted as being available only with Foundry Agent Service. It is referenced in the global availability lists with a specific version stamp. Availability is constrained to the Foundry Agent Service rather than general deployment.

item.title: FLUX.2-pro
item.description: A Black Forest Labs image generation and editing model that supports both text and image prompts, including multi-reference inputs. Key features include support for up to 8 reference images (via API), more grounded outputs, and greater output flexibility. It is available as Global Standard in all regions and can be used via the BFL provider API.

item.title: FLUX.1-Kontext-pro
item.description: A Black Forest Labs in-context image generation and editing model supporting text and image inputs. Key features include character consistency and advanced editing, with additional provider-specific parameters such as seed and aspect ratio. It is available as Global Standard in all regions via both the Image API endpoints and the BFL provider API (preview api-version).

item.title: FLUX-1.1-pro
item.description: A Black Forest Labs text-to-image generation model designed for fast inference and strong prompt adherence. It offers competitive pricing and scalable generation, with provider-specific parameters such as width/height and seed. It is available as Global Standard in all regions via the Image API and the BFL provider API (preview api-version).

item.title: Cohere-rerank-v4.0-pro
item.description: A Cohere rerank/text-classification model for ranking and relevance tasks across many languages. It outputs JSON and does not support tool calling. It is available in Global Standard (all regions) and via managed compute.

item.title: Cohere-rerank-v4.0-fast
item.description: A faster Cohere rerank/text-classification model for relevance ranking across many languages. It outputs JSON and does not support tool calling. It is available in Global Standard (all regions) and via managed compute.

item.title: Cohere-command-a
item.description: A Cohere chat-completion model optimized for tasks like reasoning, summarization, and question answering. It supports tool calling and can return text or JSON. It is available in Global Standard across all regions.

item.title: embed-v-4-0
item.description: A Cohere embeddings model that supports both text and image inputs and outputs vectors with selectable dimensions. It supports multiple languages and is intended for retrieval and similarity use cases. It is available in Global Standard across all regions.

item.title: DeepSeek-V3.2-Speciale
item.description: A DeepSeek chat-completion model that includes reasoning content and targets step-by-step reasoning tasks. It supports large input/output token limits and returns text or JSON without tool calling. It is available in Global Standard across all regions.

item.title: DeepSeek-V3.2
item.description: A DeepSeek chat-completion model with reasoning content designed for language, scientific reasoning, and coding tasks. It supports large input/output token limits and returns text or JSON without tool calling. It is available in Global Standard across all regions.

item.title: DeepSeek-V3.1
item.description: A DeepSeek chat-completion model with reasoning content that supports tool calling. It targets step-by-step reasoning tasks and returns text or JSON. It is available in Global Standard across all regions.

item.title: DeepSeek-R1-0528
item.description: A DeepSeek reasoning chat-completion model with very large input/output limits. It does not support tool calling and returns text output. It is available in both Global Standard and Global Provisioned managed across all regions.

item.title: DeepSeek-V3-0324
item.description: A DeepSeek chat-completion model that supports tool calling and returns text or JSON. It targets large-context chat and reasoning-adjacent workloads. It is available in both Global Standard and Global Provisioned managed across all regions.

item.title: DeepSeek-R1
item.description: A DeepSeek reasoning chat-completion model with very large input/output limits. It does not support tool calling and returns text output. It is available in both Global Standard and Global Provisioned managed across all regions.

item.title: Llama-4-Maverick-17B-128E-Instruct-FP8
item.description: A Meta multimodal chat-completion model supporting text and image inputs with very large context limits. It targets multilingual reasoning and generation and returns text output without tool calling. It is available in Global Standard across all regions.

item.title: Llama-3.3-70B-Instruct
item.description: A Meta chat-completion model designed for instruction-following across multiple languages. It supports large input context with a smaller output limit and returns text output without tool calling. It is available in Global Standard across all regions.

item.title: MAI-DS-R1
item.description: A Microsoft chat-completion model with reasoning content and very large input/output limits. It does not support tool calling and returns text output. It is available in Global Standard across all regions.

item.title: mistral-document-ai-2512
item.description: A Mistral Image-to-Text model for extracting text from images or PDF pages (up to 30 pages / 30MB). It returns text (and can format as JSON/Markdown) and does not support tool calling. It is available in Global Standard (all regions) and Data Zone Standard (US and EU).

item.title: mistral-document-ai-2505
item.description: A Mistral Image-to-Text model for extracting text from images or PDF pages (up to 30 pages / 30MB). It returns text (and can format as JSON/Markdown) and does not support tool calling. It is available in Global Standard (all regions) and Data Zone Standard (US and EU).

item.title: Mistral-Large-3
item.description: A Mistral multimodal chat-completion model supporting text and image inputs with tool calling. It returns text or JSON and supports multiple languages. It is available in Global Standard specifically in West US 3.

item.title: Kimi-K2.5
item.description: A Moonshot AI multimodal reasoning model that accepts text and image input and returns text output with reasoning content. It supports tool calling and very large input/output token limits. It is available in Global Standard across all regions.

item.title: Kimi-K2-Thinking
item.description: A Moonshot AI reasoning model described as the latest and most capable open-source thinking model. It accepts text input and returns text output with reasoning content, and supports tool calling. It is available in Global Standard across all regions.

item.title: grok-4
item.description: An xAI Grok chat-completion model designed for enterprise use cases such as extraction, coding, summarization, and agentic applications. It supports tool calling and returns text output. Registration is required for access, and it is available in Global Standard across all regions.

item.title: grok-4-fast-reasoning
item.description: An xAI Grok chat-completion model variant optimized for fast reasoning, supporting text and image inputs. It supports tool calling and returns text output with large input/output limits. It is available in Global Standard (all regions) and Data Zone Standard (US).

item.title: grok-4-fast-non-reasoning
item.description: An xAI Grok chat-completion model variant optimized for fast non-reasoning workloads, supporting text and image inputs. It supports tool calling and returns text output with large input/output limits. It is available in Global Standard (all regions) and Data Zone Standard (US).

item.title: grok-code-fast-1
item.description: An xAI Grok chat-completion model optimized for coding scenarios. It supports tool calling and returns text output. Registration is required for access, and it is available in Global Standard across all regions.

item.title: grok-3
item.description: An xAI Grok chat-completion model supporting large-context text workloads with tool calling. It returns text output and targets enterprise agentic and reasoning-adjacent use cases. It is available in Global Standard (all regions) and Data Zone Standard (US).

item.title: grok-3-mini
item.description: A smaller xAI Grok chat-completion model supporting large-context text workloads with tool calling. It returns text output and is positioned for enterprise use cases requiring scale. It is available in Global Standard (all regions) and Data Zone Standard (US).

item.title: Ministral-3B (preview)
item.description: A Mistral model listed in the fine-tuning table as a preview offering with unknown training data and output limits. It is marked as not supported for standard regions in the fine-tuning context but available for global training (with developer not supported). Availability details are limited to the fine-tuning section metadata.

item.title: Qwen-32B (preview)
item.description: A Qwen model listed in the fine-tuning table as a preview offering. It has an 8,000 token input and 32,000 token output limit for fine-tuning requests, with training data up to July 2024. Availability details are limited to the fine-tuning section metadata.
